definition.name: NXcorrector_cs
definition.doc:
Corrector for aberrations in an electron microscope.
Different technology partners use different naming schemes and models for quantifying the aberration coefficients.
The corrector in an electron microscope is composed of multiple lenses and multipole stigmators with vendor-specific details which are often undisclosed.

field.name: description
field.doc: Ideally, a (globally) unique persistent identifier, link, or text to a resource which gives further details. If this does not exist a free-text field to report further details about the corrector.

group.name: ZEMLIN_TABLEAU
group.doc: Specific information about the concrete alignment procedure which is a process during which the corrector is configured to enable a calibrated usage of the microscope.

field.name: description
field.doc: Discouraged free-text field to add further details about the alignment procedure.

field.name: tilt_angle
field.doc: The outer tilt angle of the beam in tableau aquisition.

field.name: exposure_time
field.doc: The exposure time of the single tilt images.

field.name: magnification
field.doc: The factor of enlargement of the apparent size, not physical size, of an object.

group.doc: Place for storing measured or estimated aberrations (for each image or final).
